alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Middlesex, east central King and Queen, Northumberland, southeastern Richmond, southeastern Essex and Lancaster Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Heathsville to near Center Cross. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, nickel size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Heathsville around 1220 PM EDT. Fair Port, Morattico and Wicomico Church around 115 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lottsburg, Regina, Mollusk, Senora, Avalon, Brook Vale, Nuttsville, Bertrand, Ino and Dragonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond
